newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: RUGBY UNION - All Blacks hit training hard in S.A..
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION - All Blacks hit training hard in S.A..

text.p: PRETORIA, July 14 - A vigorous training session kicked off a tough week for the All Blacks as they started preparing for Sunday's (NZ time) rugby test against the Springboks at Johannesburg, NZPA reports.
The physical, high-tempo two-hour session was just what coach John Hart was looking for to set the rhythm and intensity for the rest of the week leading to the tri-series opener at Ellis Park.
Though Hart hadn't planned for such a start to the week, he let the session take it its course, and later described it as satisfying.
Hart expects the Springboks, coming off the final test win over the British Lions after losing the three-match series, to spring a ferocious forward game in an attempt to catch his team by surprise.
Captain Sean Fitzpatrick led today's training session and their non-stop back-breaking work on scrummaging confirmed a fierce forward battle in the making on Sunday.
Hart will name his team here tomorrow and said he had a fully fit squad to pick from.

It appears that Andrew Mehrtens will return to first five-eighth after missing the last three tests, against Argentina (twice) and Australia, and Alama Ieremia will replace Lee Stensness at second five-eighth.
Mehrtens has made a full recovery from the nagging hamstring problem, which enabled Carlos Spencer to play his first three tests in succession.
Ieremia has also overcome a broken collar-bone.
His physical presence in the backline and ability to smash through defences give him the edge over Stensness for opponents like South Africa.
